subject: Parenting
title: Why Children Misbehave
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Why Children Misbehave.

hook.text: A child throws food on the floor for the tenth time today. She's not evil. She has an unmet need.

buildup.text: Rudolf Dreikurs identified four goals behind misbehavior: attention, power, revenge, and inadequacy.

discovery.text: Most misbehavior is a child's unskilled attempt to meet a legitimate need â€” connection, autonomy, or safety.

twist.text: Addressing the need underneath the behavior is more effective than punishing the behavior itself.

climax.text: A child who feels connected rarely acts out. Misbehavior is often a signal, not a defiance.

punchline.text: Behind every misbehavior is an unmet need trying to speak.

quiz.question: According to Dreikurs, what drives most childhood misbehavior?
options: Unmet needs for attention, power, revenge, or competence
